actions.visibilityRule: Thread replies are visible to the same channelâ€™s members; threads inherit visibility from their parent messageâ€™s channel.

Sprint 12 â€” proposed plan & checklist

1) Sprint goals (top 3)
- Stabilize Model Eval pipeline for reliable nightly runs.
- Ship basic observability for inference infra (metrics + dashboards + alerts).
- Complete feature-flag hookup for A/B experiments.

2) Scope (deliverables)
- CI job + scheduler for eval pipeline with retry logic and alerting on failures.
- Metrics exporter + Grafana dashboards for latency/error rate SLOs.
- Feature-flag integration and a minimal UI to toggle experiments.

3) Priorities & trade-offs
- Reliability and observability first. If capacity is tight, delay non-critical UI polish.
- Favor small, testable PRs to keep review/rollout fast.

4) Proposed owners (please confirm)
- Pipeline scheduling & retries: (TBD)
- Metrics exporter & dashboards: (TBD)
- Feature-flag integration: (TBD)
Iâ€™ll create tickets once owners are confirmed.

5) Definition of Done
- Nightly eval runs automated and reporting pass/fail.
- Dashboards with baseline SLOs and alerting rules in place.
- PRs merged and smoke-tested in staging.

6) Risks & mitigations
- Schema changes: add migration plan + backward-compatible reads.
- Flaky tests: invest in deterministic fixtures up front.
- Infra quotas: verify environments this week.

Action items
- Owners confirm by EOD today so I can create tickets and estimate capacity.
- Iâ€™ll draft minimal ticket list + capacity split tomorrow morning.

Questions for the group
- Who can own the metrics exporter and CI scheduling?
- Any known blockers (vacation, infra quotas) for Sprint 12?

If you agree, Iâ€™ll convert this into tickets and a proposed capacity breakdown.

Thanks Leo â€” this looks like a solid starting point. A few concrete proposals so Sprint 12 has measurable success and clear owners:

1) Stabilize Model Eval pipeline
- Success criteria: â‰¥95% nightly runs complete within the target SLA (e.g., 4 hours) for 7 consecutive days; no critical errors left unacknowledged for >1 hour.
- Deliverables: end-to-end smoke test in CI that validates core data paths, automated retries with backoff for transient failures, instrumentation of run status/latency metrics into Prometheus/Grafana.
- Offer: I can own the smoke test + the initial metrics instrumentation. Iâ€™ll need infra creds and confirmation on the SLA time window.

2) Ship basic observability
- Success criteria: dashboard panels for run success rate, latency distribution, and top error types; alert rules for failure rate >5% in 24h or a single-night complete failure; a short runbook for on-call triage.
- Offer: I can assemble the dashboard panels and draft the runbook (PR + short walkthrough).

3) Prioritization & scope
- Recommend we triage tasks by risk â†’ impact; focus first on end-to-end reliability checks and alerts that prevent silent failures.

Next steps: Can I take ownership of the smoke test + dashboard work for this sprint? Happy to sync for 20â€“30m with whoever owns infra (Leo?) to get access and align acceptance criteria.

events.content:
Locking owners & acceptance criteria for Sprint 12 so we have measurable success. Please ack or propose changes by EOD tomorrow.

Top 3 goals (owners + acceptance criteria)

1) Stabilize Model Eval pipeline for reliable nightly runs
- Owner: Priya Narang (ML)
- Acceptance criteria:
  - Nightly job completes end-to-end without manual intervention for 95%+ of runs (measured over the sprint)
  - Failures generate an actionable alert (Pager/Slack) with reproducible run artifacts and a failing test ID
  - Integration test that runs locally/CI against a small sample dataset and is green in prod-like staging
  - Run time not increased >25% vs today (or documented reason)
- Key tasks: root-cause flaky jobs, add retries/backoff, durable intermediate storage, add integration test

2) Ship baseline observability for model infra
- Owner (PM): Dani Alvarez â€” owns acceptance & UX for dashboards/alerts
- Engineering owner: please volunteer (needs to implement instrumentation)
- Acceptance criteria:
  - Dashboard(s) showing nightly run success rate, latency, and key eval metrics
  - Alerts for failures or sustained degradation (documented thresholds)
  - Instrumentation added to pipeline components with tracing/metrics (metrics emitted to prometheus/Datadog)
  - Short README for how to interpret the dashboard and where alerts route
- Key tasks: define metrics, add metrics/emission, create dashboard, wire alerts

3) Publish runbook + handoff for on-call response to eval failures
- Owner: Leo Park (coordination) â€” will draft and get owners to sign off
- Acceptance criteria:
  - Runbook in repo with triage steps, rollback/mitigation steps, key contacts, and playbook for common failure modes
  - On-call rota or escalation path documented in runbook
  - Run a 15-min tabletop drill during the sprint to validate runbook
- Key tasks: collect failure modes from Priya, draft playbook, review with SRE/PM

Org/process items
- Weekly sync: quick 30-min on Tues to unblock owners (first sync next Tue)
- Mid-sprint demo: show stable nightly run + dashboards (owner demos)
- If youâ€™re assigned above and this is incorrect, or you can volunteer as engineering owner for observability, reply here with a thumbs-up + short note by EOD tomorrow.

Next steps for owners now
- Priya: confirm you own #1 and add 3 concrete blockers you need removed
- Dani: confirm acceptance criteria for #2 or suggest changes
- Engineering volunteers: please claim the engineering owner for #2 (reply here)
- I will draft the runbook template and post it by EOD today for review

If no objections, Iâ€™ll lock these and add tasks to the sprint board tomorrow morning.

events.content:
Proposal for the landing-page messaging A/B test â€” concise plan and next steps:

Variants (3):
- Variant A (Outcome): â€œShip faster with AI-driven release notesâ€ / sub: â€œGenerate release notes, changelogs, and summaries in secondsâ€ / CTA: â€œTry freeâ€
- Variant B (Speed): â€œWrite release notes 10x fasterâ€ / sub: â€œFrom PR to changelog in one clickâ€ / CTA: â€œGet startedâ€
- Variant C (Trust): â€œTrusted by teams to streamline releasesâ€ / sub: â€œAutomate notes, reduce mistakes, keep stakeholders informedâ€ / CTA: â€œSee demoâ€

Primary metric: CTA click â†’ trial signup conversion. Secondary: bounce rate, time-on-page.

Sample & duration: target ~10k visitors or 2 weeks (whichever hits statistical threshold first). If traffic low, run 50/50/50 until 95% CI or minimum detectable effect ~15% uplift.

Ownership & assets: Iâ€™ll set up the experiment in Optimizely. Need final copy + hero image from design by EOD Thursday. Growth to add tracking for signup attribution.

Roll decision: promote variant if it beats control by >=15% in signup conversion and is statistically significant.

If there are no objections Iâ€™ll create the experiment draft and share before launch. Any edits or volunteers to own tracking?

Quick, concrete execution plan + next steps for the 3â€‘variant landing messaging A/B test.

Goal & hypothesis
- Goal: Increase visitorâ†’signup conversion (primary), with secondary lifts in hero CTA CTR and demo requests. 
- Hypothesis: Variant A (Outcome) will increase conversions vs control by making value immediate and measurable.

Primary metric
- Visitor â†’ signup_complete (tracked in analytics/GA + backend event). Secondary: hero_cta_click, signup_start, bounce_rate, time_on_page.

Sample & run rules
- Run for a fixed window: launch 2025â€‘08â€‘28, run 14 days (stop 2025â€‘09â€‘11) OR earlier if we hit 300 conversions per variant. 
- Stopping rules: declare winner early only if posterior probability >95% that lift â‰¥10% (or equivalent agreed threshold). Otherwise analyze at window end.

Tracking & experiment setup
- Randomize at page load with experiment platform (client or server) and persist assignment (cookie/session) to prevent leakage. 
- Events required: page_view, hero_cta_click, signup_start, signup_complete, experiment_assignment. Ensure experiment_assignment is sent with conversion events.
- Verify UTMs and referral attribution remain intact for cohorts.

QA checklist before launch

- No caching issues causing mixed exposures. 
- Events fire and map to experiment buckets (smoke test with 50â€“100 visits).

- 8/26â€“8/27: engineering implements variants; Alex sets up analytics & dashboard
- 8/28: launch experiment
- 9/11: end test; 9/12: share results + recommended winner and rollout plan
